sunlight: Full sun only if soil kept moist
description: The Hardy Begonia (Begonia grandis) is an exquisite, long-blooming plant that is perfect for the outdoor garden. Its large, thick, and tender leaves are a deep green, and the stems are shallowly toothed. During the summer, the Hardy Begonia blooms with clusters of small, pink, cup-shaped flowers which draw in butterflies and other pollinators. It thrives in areas with partial to full shade and rich, moist soil. Hardy to -10 degrees Fahrenheit, this Begonia species is perfect for temperate climates and can even be used as a groundcover. It's a great choice to liven up shady areas and can provide a splash of color and pollinator activity year-round.
